title: At what point in the Star Trek timeline did James T. Kirk meet a woman named Antonia? - Quora
tags: Captain James T. Kirk (Star Trek character)

response.answer_text: Kirk met Antonia while horseriding on a Spring day near his uncle’s barn in Idaho, eleven years before being swept into the Nexus in 2293 (78 years before 2371, the year in which the main bulk of the film, as well as DS9 Season 3 and VOY Season 1, takes place). This puts his meeting with Antonia in 2282; between The Motion Picture and The Wrath of Khan. Star Trek: The Motion Picture picks up only a few short years after the original TV series, at least two-and-a-half years after the end of the five-year mission, despite a whole decade having elapsed off-screen. The Wrath of Khan took a different tack, acknowledging the passage of time and dealing with Kirk’s mid-life crisis as he reaches middle age. Generations establishes that between the two films, Kirk temporarily retired from Starfleet and had a relationship with Antonia, but chose to leave her and return to duty, preparing her favourite meal to “soften the blow.” Non-canonical tie-in novels have named the character Antonia Salvatori after the stunt actress Lynn Salvatori, who played her, and have offered differing accounts of the relationship (David R George’s novel The Star to Every Wandering is inconsistent with David A Goodman’s The Autobiography of James T. Kirk, for example).

Isn’t Antonia from William Shatner’s return of Kirk books (particularly Ashes of Eden) set in the 24th Century, a few years after the film, Generations, and around the time Janeway and her crew get home?
2282. After The Motion Picture but before Wrath of Khan. She was meant to be Carol Marcus. Antonia
